thread.title: Shizen Energy, Kawasemi Kurabu Complete 1.55MW Solar Plant in Oita
thread.title_full: Shizen Energy, Kawasemi Kurabu Complete 1.55MW Solar Plant in Oita

title: Shizen Energy, Kawasemi Kurabu Complete 1.55MW Solar Plant in Oita
text:
Shizen Energy, Kawasemi Kurabu Complete 1.55MW Solar Plant in Oita Shizen Energy, Kawasemi Kurabu Complete 1.55MW Solar Plant in Oita 2015/09/22 13:29 Kenji Kaneko, Nikkei BP CleanTech Institute The completed solar power plant (source: Shizen Energy) 
Shizen Energy Inc announced Sept 7, 2015, that it has completed a 1.55MW solar power plant in Taketa City, Oita Prefecture, Japan, through a joint investment with Kawasemi Kurabu (Taketa City, Oita Prefecture). 
Denken Co Ltd provided construction services, and The Howa Bank Ltd financed part of the construction cost. Juwi Shizen Energy Inc was responsible for engineering and procurement. 
At the plant, 5,000 solar panels manufactured by BYD Co Ltd were installed. The PV inverter is a 630kW product of SMA Solar Technology AG, and the mounting system is a product of Powerway Renewable Energy Co Ltd.
